properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:07PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 1007 PM EST...a strong thunderstorm was over Plant Harlee Branch,
or 7 miles north of Milledgeville...moving northeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of this storm include
Milledgeville, Eatonton, Sparta, Reynolds at Lake Oconee,
Midway-Hardwick, Liberty, Meriwether, Ethridge, Veazey, Devereux,
Beulah, Underwood, Allenwood, Resseaus Crossroads, Oconee Springs
Park, Rockville, Plant Harlee Branch, Browns Crossing, Shoulderbone
and Culverton.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

LAT...LON 3303 8335 3316 8351 3354 8315 3324 8278
TIME...MOT...LOC 0307Z 233DEG 30KT 3319 8326

WIND...40MPH

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR EASTERN PUTNAM...NORTHERN BALDWIN...HANCOCK...NORTHEASTERN JONES AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES UNTIL 1030 PM EST
